ch.epfl.biop.operetta

Class OperettaManager.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.biop.operetta.OperettaManager.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    OperettaManager

    public static class OperettaManager.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    This Builder class handles creating OperettaManager objects for you If you're curious about the Builder Pattern, you can read Joshua Bloch's excellent Effective Java Book Use When creating a new OperettaManager object, call the Builder, add all the options and then call the build() method 
     * 
 * OperettaManager opm = new OperettaManager.Builder()
 									.setId( id )
 									.setSaveFolder( save_dir )
 								//  Other options here
 									.build();
 * 
 *

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      OperettaManager build()
      The build method handles creating an OperettaManager object from all the settings that were provided.
      OperettaManager.Builder doProjection(boolean do_projection)
      Determines whether the OperettaManager will Z Project the data before saving it, using setProjectionMethod(String)
      OperettaManager.Builder setId(java.io.File id)
      This sets the id (the path to the image file), as per Bioformat's definition In the case of Operetta Data, the ID is the 'Index.idx.xml' file you get when you export it.
      OperettaManager.Builder setNormalization(int min, int max)
      Sets the values for min-max normalization In the case of digital phase images, these are in 32-bits and ImageJ cannot mix 32-bit images with 16-bit images (the standard Operetta bit depth).
      OperettaManager.Builder setProjectionMethod(java.lang.String method)
      The projection method to use if we are using doProjection(boolean)
      OperettaManager.Builder setRange(HyperRange range)
      Can provide a range (Channels, Slices and Timepoints) to use for export.
      OperettaManager.Builder setSaveFolder(java.io.File save_folder)
      Provides the save folder to which data will be exported to

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder()

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public OperettaManager build()
        The build method handles creating an OperettaManager object from all the settings that were provided. This is done so that everything, like the HyperRange that is defined is valid.
        Returns:
        the instance to the OperettaManager.

      • doProjection

        public OperettaManager.Builder doProjection(boolean do_projection)
        Determines whether the OperettaManager will Z Project the data before saving it, using setProjectionMethod(String)
        Parameters:
        do_projection - true if we wish to perform a Z projection
        Returns:
        a Builder object, to continue building parameters

      • setId

        public OperettaManager.Builder setId(java.io.File id)
        This sets the id (the path to the image file), as per Bioformat's definition In the case of Operetta Data, the ID is the 'Index.idx.xml' file you get when you export it. This is usually provided as an absolute path
        Parameters:
        id - the full path of 'Index.idx.xml', in String format
        Returns:
        a Builder object, to continue building parameters

      • setNormalization

        public OperettaManager.Builder setNormalization(int min,
                                                int max)
        Sets the values for min-max normalization In the case of digital phase images, these are in 32-bits and ImageJ cannot mix 32-bit images with 16-bit images (the standard Operetta bit depth). So we set the min and max display range that will be converted to 0-65535
        Parameters:
        min - value of the digital phase image that will be set to 0
        max - value of the digital phase image that will be set to 65535
        Returns:
        a Builder object, to continue building parameters

      • setProjectionMethod

        public OperettaManager.Builder setProjectionMethod(java.lang.String method)
        The projection method to use if we are using doProjection(boolean)
        Parameters:
        method - String that matches one of the strings in the ZProjector
        Returns:
        a Builder object, to continue building parameters

      • setRange

        public OperettaManager.Builder setRange(HyperRange range)
        Can provide a range (Channels, Slices and Timepoints) to use for export. If none are provided, will export the full range of the data
        Parameters:
        range - the HyperRange object, see corresponding class
        Returns:
        a Builder object, to continue building parameters

      • setSaveFolder

        public OperettaManager.Builder setSaveFolder(java.io.File save_folder)
        Provides the save folder to which data will be exported to
        Parameters:
        save_folder - the folder. If not created, this method will try to create it.
        Returns:
        a Builder object, to continue building parameters
